metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11454 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Persistent cross-site scripting (XSS) in http/cervlet.c in Tildeslash Monitbefore 5.25.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to introducearbitrary JavaScript via manipulation of an unsanitized user field of theAuthorization header for HTTP Basic Authentication, which is mishandledduring an _viewlog operation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11454` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

monit - 1:5.25.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: monit package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:5.25.3-1').
